text: John Vesey was an 18th-century Anglican priest in Ireland."A New History of Ireland" T. W. Moody, F. X. Martin, F.J. Byrne and Cosgrove, A: Oxford, OUP, 1976 The son of John Vesey, Archbishop of Tuam, and his second wife Anne Muschamp, he was educated at Trinity College, Dublin."Alumni Dublinenses : a register of the students, graduates, professors and provosts of Trinity College in the University of Dublin (1593–1860George Dames Burtchaell/Thomas Ulick Sadleir p76: Dublin, Alex Thom and Co, 1935 Vesey was Rector of Ballinrobe.NUI Galway In 1706 he was appointed Prebendary of Kilmoylan at Tuam Cathedral."Fasti Ecclesiae Hibernicae: The succession of the prelates Volume 4" Cotton,H. p37 Dublin, Hodges & Smith, 1848–1878 Vesey was Archdeacon of Kilfenora from 1714Fryde, E. B.; Greenway, D. E.; Porter, S.; Roy, I. (1986). Handbook of British Chronology (Third Edition, reprinted 2003 ed.). Cambridge: Cambridge University Press. pp. 360–361 to 1743."Fasti Ecclesiae Hibernicae: The succession of the prelates Volume 1" Cotton,H. pp511/12 Dublin, Hodges & Smith, 1848–1878 ==References== Category:Deans of Kilfenora Category:Archdeacons of Kilfenora Category:18th-century Irish Anglican priests Category:Alumni of Trinity College Dublin
title: John Vesey (archdeacon)
